What is AI?: AI stands for Artificial Intelligence, the simulation of human intelligence in machines.
What is Machine Learning?: Machine Learning is a subset of AI that enables computers to learn from data.
What is a CPU?: CPU stands for Central Processing Unit, and it's responsible for executing instructions in a computer.
What is a GPU?: A GPU is a Graphics Processing Unit, mainly used for rendering images and training AI models.
What is the difference between HTTP and: HTTPS is the secure version of HTTP, using encryption to protect data.
What is cloud computing?: Cloud computing is the delivery of computing services over the internet.
What is an API?: An API (Application Programming Interface) allows different software systems to communicate.
What is Git?: Git is a distributed version control system used to track changes in source code.
What is open-source software?: Open-source software is software with source code that anyone can inspect, modify, and enhance.
What is cybersecurity?: Cybersecurity is the practice of protecting systems and networks from digital attacks.
What is HTML?: HTML stands for HyperText Markup Language and is used to structure content on the web.
What is JavaScript?: JavaScript is a programming language used to make web pages interactive.
What is Python?: Python is a high-level, interpreted programming language known for its readability.
What is blockchain?: Blockchain is a distributed ledger technology that securely records transactions across many computers.
What is encryption?: Encryption is the process of converting data into a secure format to prevent unauthorized access.
What is the Internet of Things (IoT)?: IoT refers to the network of physical devices connected to the internet, collecting and sharing data.
What is a firewall?: A firewall is a network security device that monitors and filters incoming and outgoing traffic.
What is a domain name?: A domain name is the address people type in a browser to visit your website, like example.com.
What is DNS?: DNS stands for Domain Name System; it translates domain names into IP addresses.
What is an IP address?: An IP address is a unique number assigned to each device connected to the internet.
What is software development?: Software development is the process of designing, coding, testing, and maintaining applications.
What is agile methodology?: Agile is a software development method based on iterative development and customer feedback.
What is Scrum?: Scrum is a framework for agile project management, focusing on teamwork and accountability.
What is DevOps?: DevOps is a set of practices that combines software development and IT operations.
What is a virtual machine?: A virtual machine is a software emulation of a computer that runs an operating system.
What is a container in tech?: Containers are lightweight, standalone packages that include everything needed to run a piece of software.
What is Docker?: Docker is a platform used to develop, ship, and run applications inside containers.
What is Kubernetes?: Kubernetes is an open-source system for automating the deployment and scaling of containerized apps.
What is a compiler?: A compiler translates source code written in a programming language into machine code.
What is a text editor?: A text editor is a program used to write and edit code, such as VS Code or Sublime Text.
What is the difference between frontend: Frontend refers to the UI of a website, while backend involves server-side logic and databases.
What is a framework?: A framework is a set of tools and libraries that helps developers build applications more efficiently.
What is artificial general intelligence: AGI refers to machines with human-level intelligence across a wide range of tasks.
What is a neural network?: A neural network is a series of algorithms that mimic the human brain to recognize patterns and data.
What is version control?: Version control systems help track changes to code and coordinate work among developers.
What is SSH?: SSH (Secure Shell) is a protocol used to securely connect to remote servers.
What is SaaS?: SaaS stands for Software as a Service — software hosted in the cloud and accessed via the internet.
What is latency in networking?: Latency is the delay between sending and receiving data over a network.
What is bandwidth?: Bandwidth is the maximum rate of data transfer across a network path.
What is a bug in programming?: A bug is an error or flaw in a software program that causes incorrect results.
What is debugging?: Debugging is the process of finding and fixing bugs in code.
What is a database index?: An index is a data structure that improves the speed of data retrieval operations on a database.
What is SQL?: SQL (Structured Query Language) is used to communicate with and manipulate databases.
What is NoSQL?: NoSQL databases store data in formats other than relational tables, like documents or key-value pairs.
What is JSON?: JSON (JavaScript Object Notation) is a lightweight format for storing and exchanging data.
What is REST API?: REST is an architectural style for building web services that use HTTP methods to access resources.
What is OAuth?: OAuth is an open standard for access delegation, commonly used for token-based authentication.
What is a software license?: A software license defines how software can be used and distributed.
What is responsive design?: Responsive design ensures a website looks good on all screen sizes and devices.
What is a CDN?: A CDN (Content Delivery Network) is a system of distributed servers that deliver web content based on user location.
What is a browser cookie?: A cookie is a small file stored on a user’s device by a website to remember information.
What is two-factor authentication?: Two-factor authentication adds a second layer of security by requiring a second form of verification.
What is biometrics in technology?: Biometrics refers to using physical characteristics like fingerprints for identification and security.
What is a cache?: A cache stores data temporarily to speed up future access.
What is virtualization?: Virtualization is the process of creating a virtual version of something, like a server or OS.
What is a logic gate?: A logic gate is a basic building block of digital circuits that performs a logical operation.
What is binary code?: Binary code is the language computers use, consisting of 0s and 1s.
What is an operating system kernel?: The kernel is the core of an operating system, managing system resources and communication.
What is multitasking in operating system: Multitasking allows multiple processes to run concurrently on a computer.
